aboutUs.title: About us
aboutUs.intro: Being a landlord is getting tougher. Costs are on the rise and so are taxes.

content.heading: But, purchasing your investment property through a company can help solve this.
content.text:
There are many other benefits too. Such as, protecting your wealth, helping plan for inheritance and easily buying with others.

After all, an investment property is a business and companies are designed for business. At GetGround we’ve created a service that helps you capture these benefits - without the hassle or high fees.

We believe that holding property in a company helps lower costs, improve information and reduce barriers to buy and sell. As a result, we think both landlords and tenants will benefit.

Our mission is to create a fairer property market for all.

moubin.name: Moubin
moubin.text:
Moubin is the CEO of GetGround and was an investment professional at Apax Partners, one of the world’s leading private equity houses. There he was involved in numerous key transactions in the retail, consumer and services sectors.

Previously Moubin was at McKinsey & Company and is trained as a medical doctor at Imperial College where he graduated with distinctions.

misrab.name: Misrab
misrab.text:
Misrab is the CTO of GetGround. He is a computer scientist and set up the data science team and Singapore office at Go-Jek, Indonesia’s first technology ‘unicorn’.

Previously he taught data science at General Assembly, auction dynamics at TripAdvisor, and has been heavily involved in cryptographic theory and distributed ledger technology.

Misrab is Stanford University graduate with Bachelor’s and Master’s degrees focused around computer science, economics and mathematics.

tax.footnote: Tax treatment depends on the individual circumstances of each client and may be subject to change in the future

left.info4: If you sell, stamp duty land tax for the buyer

feed1.info1: Same taxes (eg. stamp duty land tax) for personal and company ownership if you rent out your property to a third party.
feed1.info2: Fully deducted from your tax bill
feed1.info5: Also choose capital repayments or dividends

feed2.info1: Same taxes (eg. stamp duty land tax) for personal and company ownership if you rent out your property to a third party.
feed2.info5: Income tax or capital gains tax payable

company.title: ADDITIONAL COMPANY ADVANTAGES
company.info1: Purchase easily with friends, family and business partners.
company.info2: Contain your liabilities in the company. If your investment goes wrong your personal wealth is safer.
company.info3: Using a company could mean you get a bigger mortgage. It could also mean banks have lower income requirements for you.

left.info4: Reduce your income requirements from mortgage lenders

feed1.info1: Max 4 people on a title deed & no governance agreements

feed2.info1: Unlimited owners protected by governance agreements
feed2.info2: Contain your liabilities in the company as a separate legal entity
feed2.info3: Potentially easier bank tests (rental income vs. interest expense)
feed2.info4: Typically banks require a combined shareholder income of £25k p.a.

advantages.title: Advantages
advantages.intro:
There are many advantages to purchasing your buy-to-let property through a company such as tax efficiency, better protecting your wealth and easily purchasing with your friends, family and business partners.

GetGround allows you to capture these benefits without the high fees usually associated with running a company.

content.heading: Get UK tax advantages
content.text: The UK government has put in place tax advantages that landlords can take advantage of if purchasing property through a company.

columns.heading: Get access to capital
columns.text:
Through our carefully selected brokers we get you access to over 25 lenders that specialise in company buy-to-let mortgages.

You also have access to capital from other benefits that come from purchasing through a company:

others.heading: Purchase with others
others.text: Reduce your mortgage needs by easily purchasing with up to 7 other people that you choose (maximum 8 shareholders in a company).

mortgage.heading: Access a bigger mortgage
mortgage.text: Get access to a potentially bigger mortgage. Banks tend to have easier tests for rental income vs interest costs when using a company than when making a personal purchase.

income.heading: Lower income requirements
income.text: Companies have different income requirements from mortgage lenders. Typically banks require a combined shareholder income of £25k per year.

comparison.heading: Company buy-to-let mortgage deals currently in the market

moreInfo.info1: GetGround services are for investors of residential property that will be rented out. The property must be in England and Wales.
moreInfo.info2: All GetGround companies are UK Limited companies.
moreInfo.info3: Each GetGround company only ever holds one property. This means:
moreInfo.info4: You are better protected as each asset’s liability is contained in a separate company.
moreInfo.info5: You can easily buy or sell a property just by changing ownership in the shares of the company holding it.
moreInfo.info6: It can take as little as 20 minutes to own a GetGround company. You just need to sign-up to our platform and we will ask some details about you, your property and who you want to own your company with.
moreInfo.info7: It is easy to manage your company through the GetGround website. Everything you need in one place.
moreInfo.info8: You should engage GetGround before exchange of your property contracts.

home.title: Smarter property purchasing for landlords. Make your money work harder.
home.intro: GetGround lets you purchase your property tax efficiently through a company, without the hassle and high fees.

whatWeDo.heading: What we do
whatWeDo.content:
We want to make life easier and more profitable for landlords.

Purchasing property through a company can be tax efficient. There are many other benefits, such as protecting your wealth, planning for inheritance or easily buying with others.

With us, you can purchase your property through a company, without the complexity and costs of setting up and managing it.
whatWeDo.box:
We make it easy and affordable to purchase your property through a company by providing:

  • A UK Limited company for you
  • A company bank account
  • All required company legal documents
  • Company accounts
  • Company tax filings
  • Company secretarial work (inc. registered office and filings)

columns.first:
Get lower costs, more profit, better returns.

  • Open the potential of tax efficiency vs personal property ownership.
  • Better protect your wealth if your investment goes wrong.
  • Minimise your company costs. Through technology, we are 5-10x cheaper than others in the market.
columns.second:
Get time back. Manage everything in one place.

  • Manage all your company needs through our simple website.
  • Seamlessly handle all your property needs through our network of carefully selected partners
  • Easily get in touch. Call us on the phone. Chat to us online or by email.
columns.third:
Get access to capital.

  • Buy your property alone or together with your friends, family members or business partners (maximum 8 shareholders per company).
  • Access over 25 mortgage lenders who specialise in company buy-to-let, through our carefully selected brokers.
  • Discover the potential of a larger mortgage and lower personal income requirements by using a company.

howItWorks.heading: How it works
howItWorks.content: We do everything required for your company.

step1.text: We set up a UK Limited company for you to purchase your buy-to-let property.

step2.text: We work with your lawyers to purchase your property through your new company. We also set up your company bank account.

step3.text: We manage your company for you, including accounting, tax, legal documents, filings, registered office, and even secretarial work.

outro.heading: Also
outro.text: We do not provide services for your property but can connect you to our carefully selected partners to get access to a wide range of mortgages, insurance, tax advice, solicitor and property management options.

fees.heading: Fees
fees.content: It’s free to join GetGround and you only need to pay once you set up a company through us.

trustAndPrivacy.heading: Trust and Privacy
trustAndPrivacy.content:
Trust is at the heart of our business. Everything we do is built around being open, honest and transparent at every stage.

You own and control your company, you can leave us at any time, and we work with the lawyers you trust to purchase your property through your company. We’re partly funded by the UK government through HM Land Registry.

howItWorks.title: How it works
howItWorks.intro: For a one-time sign up and small monthly subscription we will set up a company and bank account for you, coordinate with your lawyers to buy your property and then manage all your company’s needs on an on-going basis.

content.heading: SIGN-UP
content.text: It's free and quick to join GetGround. All you need is a copy of your passport and proof of address. You only need to pay if you decide to set up a company through us.

outro.heading: It's as easy as 1,2,3
outro.text: Get in touch with us at any time if you need anything at all.

step1.heading: Design your company
step1.content:
As soon as you have a property in mind to purchase, set up your company by following six simple steps:

  • Provide the address of the property your company will purchase
  • If you have it, give us your expected exchange and completion dates and payments
  • Provide your solicitor’s details (or request to be put in touch with one)
  • Let us know if you would like anyone else to be a shareholder of your company
  • Answer a simple tax question
  • Make payment for your new company

step2.heading: Coordinate with your lawyers
step2.content:
Once your company is set up we will:

  • Work with your lawyers to purchase your property through your new company
  • Set up a company bank account
  • Remind you to purchase directors & officers insurance just before the property purchase completes (you can get your own, or we can help you through our broker partner. If we help, this is an activity regulated by the Financial Conduct Authority for which we are an Appointed Representative of Resolution Compliance Ltd)

step3.heading: Manage your company
step3.content:
Once your company has purchased your property we will manage all your company’s requirements.

Simply login to your account to:

  • See your company’s and property’s details
  • Request any services you need for your company or, through our partners, for your property
  • Use your company’s bank account.

content.first: Moubin has experience in investing, commercial strategy, tax and structuring. He was an investment professional at Apax Partners, one of the world’s leading private equity houses.
content.second: There he was involved in numerous key transaction in the retail, consumer and IT services sectors. Previously Moubin was at McKinsey & Company and is trained as a medical doctor at Imperial College where he graduated with distinctions.

content.first: Misrab is a computer scientist. He set up the data science team and Singapore office at Go-Jek, Indonesia’s first technology ‘unicorn’.
content.second: Previously he taught data science at General Assembly, auction dynamics at Trip Advisor, and has been heavily involved in cryptographic theory and distributed ledger technology.
content.third: Misrab is a Stanford University graduate with Bachelor’s and Master’s degrees focused around computer science, economics and mathematics.

idCheck.text: To prove your identity we need you to take a picture of your passport, proof of address and take a picture of yourself.

passport.name: Passport
passport.title: Add a picture of your passport
passport.content: Please make sure you take a picture of the page of your passport that contains your picture and your details. The full page should be visible on the picture.
passport.retakeImageContent: Are you happy with this picture? Please make sure it is well-lit and that you can read the information clearly.

address.name: Proof of Address
address.title: Add proof of address
address.content: Now we need a picture of a utility bill, bank statement or any government letter (e.g. HMRC). Please make sure the document is recent (within the past 3 months) and the address and your name are clearly visible.
address.retakeImageContent: Are you happy with this picture? Please make sure the date, your full name and address are clearly visible.

selfie.name: Your picture
selfie.title: Take a picture of yourself
selfie.content: We need this picture so we can match it with the one in your passport. This is to make sure no one is trying to create a false account using your documents.
selfie.retakeImageContent: Are you happy with this picture? Please make sure the picture is well-lit and not blurred.

pricing.intro: It’s free to join GetGround and you only need to pay once you set up a company through us.

fees.title: Our fees
fees.text: Charged per company. Each company holds one property.

included.title: What's included
included.text:
• A UK Limited company for you
  • A company bank account
  • All required company legal documents
  • Company accounts
  • Company tax filings
  • Company secretarial work (inc. registered office and filings)

other.title: Other potential costs
other.text:
When your property transaction completes you’ll need to take out directors & officers insurance with a cover of at least £250k.

This typically costs around £200 per year but depends on the value of your property. We will prompt you when the time is right.

Our partners may charge a fee if you decide to use their services - you’ll be advised of this at the time if you request a quote from them.

taxQuestions.title: Tax questions
taxQuestions.introBox: The money you provide to purchase your property is lent by you to your company. We create a loan note between yourself and your company for this. This question determines the interest rate we should apply to your loan to the company
taxQuestions.ownership: Do you have ownership or voting rights of 25% or more in any companies, partnerships or other enterprises?
taxQuestions.employ: Do they employ more than 50 employees combined?
taxQuestions.assets: Do they have assets of 10m€ or less combined?
taxQuestions.turnover: Do they have a turnover of 10m€ or less combined?

trustAndPrivacy.title: Trust and Privacy
trustAndPrivacy.intro:
Trust is at the heart of our business.
Everything we do is built around being open, honest and transparent at every stage.

first.heading: Funded by the UK Government
first.text: We are funded in part by the Government through HM Land Registry’s Geovation program as well as being funded by other prestigious private investors.

second.heading: Compliant and secure
second.text: All GetGround customers need to pass UK approved Know-Your-Customer (KYC) and Anti-Money Laundering (AML) checks. GetGround is registered with the Information Commissioner’s Office and adheres to UK General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).

third.heading: Transparent
third.text: We believe transparency is key in establishing trust. All GetGround companies are UK limited companies and as such their details are recorded at Companies House in the UK. This is a public register that anyone is able to check and includes company details, owner and director information and copies of key company documents.

fourth.heading: Working with industry leaders
fourth.text: GetGround works with the best in the industry. All legal documents for GetGround companies are produced by CMS Cameron McKenna Nabarro Olswang LLP.

whatWeDo.title: What we do
whatWeDo.intro:
With GetGround, you can purchase your property through a company, without the complexity and costs of setting up and managing it.

We set up a company and bank account for you, and once your company owns your property we manage your company on an on-going basis.

text.p1: Our service is for anyone looking to purchase residential property in England and Wales as an investment to be rented out.
text.p2: We set up a company and bank account for you, and once your company owns your property we manage your company on an on-going basis including:
text.p3:
• All required company legal documents
  • Company accounts
  • Company tax filings
  • Company secretarial work (inc. registered office and filings)
text.p4: Ideally, you should set up your company before you exchange contracts on your property. But we still might be able to help even if you have already exchanged contracts or own property you want to transfer into a company. Get in touch to see if we can.
text.p5: For your property, we do not provide any services but can give you access to our carefully selected partners to get access to a wide range of products from mortgages to property management.

first.heading: You own and control your company
first.text:
You can buy your property alone or with up to 7 other people you choose (maximum 8 shareholders in a company). At least one shareholder needs to be a director.

GetGround is a service provider and does not have any directorship or ownership in your company. We cannot perform any activities on your company without your explicit consent and you are free to leave our services at any time without penalty.

second.heading: Companies that are designed for investment property
second.text:
All our companies are UK Limited companies. They are tailor made for investment property, which means they are tax efficient, work with mortgages and have high quality legal documentation.

Each company only ever holds one property. We believe this is better than holding multiple properties in one company.
second.more:
• You have greater control of your property portfolio. Decide what to do with each property e.g., sell one, gift another to children, or take a dividend out from another
  • You can easily buy or sell a property just by changing ownership in the shares of the company holding it
  • You are better protected as each asset is legally ring fenced in case things go wrong
  • You understand the performance of each property better as each has its own bank account and cashflows

third.heading: Your lawyers, your choice
third.text:
You can choose your own or we can connect you with our partners. They’ll need to be based in the UK and be a member of either the Solicitors Regulation Authority or the Council for Licensed Conveyancers.

Just as usual you send the money required to purchase your property to your lawyers client account. GetGround does not handle these funds.

fourth.heading: Every company comes with a bank account
fourth.text: Every company set up with GetGround comes with a bank account that is used for your property’s rental income and expenses. Your company owns the bank account and you control it.

tiles.heading: What we ask you not to do while you choose to use us
tiles.text:
We’re creating a platform that’s built on a foundation of mutual trust. With that in mind, there are a few things we ask you not to do while you choose to use our services, for both your and our benefit.

As a member of a community of trust we ask you to refrain from the following things - you’re free to choose not to, but we won’t be able to provide our services to the affected company:

content.property: Only use your company for the one property you’ve told us about. Your company should not conduct any other business.
content.investment: Only use the property for investment purposes to rent out to unrelated third parties.
content.lending: If you want to take any lending, issue or transfer any shares or take out insurance you can do so, but please let us know first.
content.employment: Do not employ anyone through the company.
content.legalDocs: Do not change any of the company’s legal documents.
content.accounting: Do not change the company’s accounting date or it’s name.
content.partnerships: Do not enter the company into any partnerships, joint ventures or incorporate any subsidiaries.
content.bankAccount: Only use the bank account given through GetGround for your company. If your mortgage lender requires you to open a bank account with them, that is fine so long as it is only used to make mortgage interest payments.

tiles.outro: For more information please see copies of the legal documents we use for GetGround companies here.
